response.answer_text: Unless your only ambition is to get into a top college like SRCC or Stephens in north campus DU it does not matter much You should be clear with your passion and choose a field which matches most with your strengths, knowledge and skillsets Its important to be street smart and confident than to be an academic topper Many world's top billionaires are college dropouts

Yeah it matters. In some fields your 12th percentage is counted for rank calculation like MBA.You should try to score your best whether it matters in future or not.In our society , 90% above scorer are treated well . Even if your score is 89.999% then also they will never treat you like the guy who has secured above 90% .
